byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Pentagon and intelligence officials express concern about significantly increased Russian submarine activity in close proximity to miles of undersea data cables that are backbone of worldwide Internet communications; some say deployment of subs, which is measured at level similar to height of Cold War, adds to already growing mistrust of Russian military intentions around world.
lead_paragraph: Russian submarines are aggressively operating near the undersea cables that carry almost all global Internet communications, raising concerns in the U.S.

headline.main: Russian Ships Near Data Cables Are Too Close for U.S. Comfort
headline.print_headline: Russian Ships Near Data Cables Are Too Close for U.S. Comfort

snippet: Russian submarines are aggressively operating near the undersea cables that carry almost all global Internet communications, raising concerns in the U.S.
